content.webTitle: Barclay brothers top Sunday Times Rich List in publishing and advertising

fields.headline: Barclay brothers top Sunday Times Rich List in publishing and advertising
fields.bodyText: Sir David and Frederick Barclay have been named at the top of a list of the richest people in publishing and advertising in Britain with a fortune of more than £2bn, while cost-cutting Richard Desmond has cemented second spot as his wealth hit £1bn. The reclusive 77-year-old twins, owners of the Daily Telegraph and Sunday Telegraph, have been named at the top of the Sunday Times Rich List with assets valued at £2.25bn. The brothers, who also own the Ritz Hotel and Littlewoods mail order business, increased their wealth by £50m over last year's rich list. Northern & Shell owner Richard Desmond also increased his wealth, cracking the £1bn mark despite ordering sweeping cuts at Express Newspapers – home to the Daily Express, Sunday Express, Daily Star and Daily Star Sunday – to save cash. Viscount Rothermere and family, controlling shareholder of Daily Mail publisher DMGT, increased their wealth by £30m to £760m to cement third spot. The 20-strong list also includes Sir Martin Sorrell, the founder of the world's largest advertising group WPP, who saw his estimated wealth rise almost 18% year-on-year to £174m to rank 12th. Alan Parker, the founder and chairman of Brunswick group, waved the flag for the PR industry with a £95m fortune to rank 19th. One of the few to lose ground year-on-year was Ray Tindle, the owner of Tindle Newspapers and investor in the UK's second largest regional newspaper owner Johnston Press, who saw his wealth fall from £145m to £125m to rank 16th.
